file_insights.purpose: Expose checklist domain models for package-level access

patterns_discovered.description: All domain models are exported from package __init__.py for clean, centralized access
patterns_discovered.benefit: Enables consumers to import from app.models instead of app.models.checklist

patterns_discovered.description: Import statements grouped by domain area (approval, area, file, audit, checklist)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Organizes related models together, improving maintainability

patterns_discovered.description: All classes from a domain module are exported, not selective exports
patterns_discovered.benefit: Ensures no models are accidentally hidden from consumers

gotchas_discovered.description: Five related classes imported from single module in one line
gotchas_discovered.risk: Long import line could exceed style guidelines depending on linter configuration
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Monitor line length; consider splitting across multiple lines if exceeds 88-100 characters

gotchas_discovered.description: New import added after audit module but before __all__ definition
gotchas_discovered.risk: If imports added out of logical order, could reduce code readability
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Maintain alphabetical or domain-based ordering convention

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully exported all five checklist-related models from the models package __init__.py file. Changes follow existing patterns in the codebase and maintain consistency with other domain model exports.

recommendations.recommendation: Consider if checklist models should be imported in any other package __init__.py files that aggregate models
If package has an API documentation or __init__.py docstring, ensure it mentions checklist models availability
Verify that importing from app.models directly works in tests/consumers: from app.models import ChecklistTemplate
